alert.note: Alert for Sussex (Delaware) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 17 at 4:54AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southern Delaware...including the following county...Sussex. * WHEN...Until 200 PM EDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding of the Nanticoke River in the vicinity of Bridgeville is imminent. The river will likely crest later this morning but continues to rise and will likely reach flood stage at least for a few hours. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 452 AM EDT, Excessive runoff from rainfall on Sunday is resulting in continued rising water levels on the Nanticoke River. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 4 and 6 inches of rain fell on Sunday. - For Nanticoke at Bridgeville: At 4:15am the stage was 9.41 feet. Flood Stage is 9.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
